NA26-d-05-28-90-SOO.Narrative: ON A WARM AND SUNNY HOLIDAY AFTERNOON, OUTBOUND TRAIN 205-28 WAS BEINGMADE UP AT GLENWOOD YARD, MP 120.00 WITH UNITS 6004-6035, 17 LOADS 67 EMPTIES, 3802 TONS. WHILE SWITCHING THE HEAD END OF THE TRAIN, THE CREW ALLOWED A CUT OF 10 LOADED ROCK HOPPERS TO DRIFT IN AN EASTWARDLY DIRECTION DOWN THE LEAD TO GLENWOOD YARD TRACK W-8 WHICH HAD THREE EMPTY J'S. THE FORCE FROM THE IMPACT CAUSED THE THIRTEEN CARS ON W-8 OUT THE EAST END LEAD AND INTO THE SIDE OF GLENWOOD YARD TRACK W-3, SIDESWIPING FIVE COVERED HOPPERS ON W-3, WHICH WAS FOULING THE LEAD ON THE EAST END OF THE YARD, SIDESWIPING FIVE COVERED HOPPERS ON W-3. ALL SIXDERAILED CARS WERE EMPTY COVERED HOPPERS. NAHX 480299 WAS THE 13TH FROM THE HEAD END OFF W-8 WHEN IT IMPACTED TILX 1876 ON W-3. NAHX 480299 CAME TO REST SEVEN FEET INTO THEAIR ON TOP OF TILX 1876. FOUR MORECARS ON W-3 WERE DERAILED IN TURN, TILX 511897 LEANING BUT SUSTAINING NO DAMAGE; NAHX 48241 WITH NO DAMAGE INCURRED; NAHX 50857 TIPPED BUT NOT ON IT'S SIDE, AND NAHX52987 TIPPED BUT NOT ON IT'S SIDE AND SUSTAINING NO DAMAGE.NoneNoneNoneNone

THEY PULLED THE TRAIN INTO THETRACK TO CLEAR THE MAIN LINE, LEAVING THE EAST MAIN TRACK SWITCH LINEDFOR THE EAST STORAGE TRACK. THE CREW CUT OFF THE HEAD END OF THE TRAIN AT WEST END OF EASTSTORAGE TRACK TO CLEAR MAIN TRACK, PULLED WEST TO MAIN TRACK. THEY LINED THE SWITCH FOR THE MAIN TRACK AND SHOVED TO THE EAST. THE TRAIN WAS LONGER THAN THEY THOUGHT IT WAS AND SHOVED THROUGH THE MAINTRACK SWITCH ON EAST END OF THE STORAGE. WHEN THEY AGAIN PULLED THE MAIN TRACK WESTBOUND, IT HAD RUN THROUGH THE SWITCH AND THE CARS DERAILED INTO THE SIDE OF THE CARS ON THE EAST STORAGE TRACK. CREWWAS UHR TESTED UNDER COMPANY PLOLICY. ALL TEST RESULTS WERE NEGATIVE. NO HAZARDOUS CARS WERE DERAILED OR DAMAGED IN THE INCIDENT. INVESTIGATION WAS HELD AND CREW SIGNED WAIVER, ACCEPTING RESPONSIBILITY. ENTIRE CREW WAS ASSESSED 15-DAYS DEFERRED SUSPENSION.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone

903-d-05-21-90-DSRC.Narrative: THIS DERAILLMENT OCCURRED MAY 21, 1990 AT MILEPOST 499 ON A DESCENDINGGRADE O F .60% AND A 1 DEGREE45 MINUTE CURVE. THE TRAIN LEFT MP 501 AT 6:10 PM AND THE DERAILMENT OCCURRED AT 6:30 PM. THE TRAINHAD 2 EMPTIES TRAILED BY 13 LOADED COVERED HOPPERS OF WHEAT. THE TRAIN WAS DESCENDING THE GRADE AT 6MPH WHEN THE TRAIN SLOWED QUICKLY AND WENT INTO AN EMERGENCY BRAKE APPLICATION. THE CAUSE OF THE DERAILMENT WAS DUETO WIDE GAUGE DUE TO FAILED AND SOFT TIES. THE TIES IN THIS LOCATION ARE ALMOST ALLFIR AND OTHER SOFT WOODS AND WERE INSTALLED 40 TO 50 YEARS AGO. CAR BN 458939 TOTALLY DERAILED BOTHTRUCKS. THE NEXT TWO CARS ROLLED OVER ON THE INSIDE OF THE CURVE, THE NORTH SIDE. THE NEXT CAR DERAILED THE EAST TRUCK AND THE TWO NORTH WHEELS ON THE NORTH SIDE OF THE WEST TRUCK. A TOTAL OF 4 CARS DERAILED.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

902-d-05-11-90-DSRC.Narrative: TRAIN 512 LEFT DRAPER, SD AT 5:40 PM ON 5-11-90 FOR VIVIAN, SD WITH 22 LOADS AND 1 EMPTY. THE DERAILMENT OCCURRED AT 6:40 PM AT MP 501. THE SITE OF DERAILMENT IS ON A .60% DESCENDING GRADE ON A 2 DEGREE CURVE. WHEN THE 18TH CART WAS AT THE POINT OF DERAILMLENT, THE INSIDE OR SOUTH RAIL ON THE CURVEBROKE UNDER THE TRAIN. THE RAIL THAT BROKE HAD A VERTICAL SPLIT HEAD THAT ALLOWED THE GAUGE SIDE OFTHE RAIL TO BREAK AND SEPARATE FROM THE REST OF THE RAIL. THIS ALLLOWED THE WHEELS OF THE 18TH CAR TO DROP BETWEEN THE RAILS SPREADING THE RAILS AND CAUSING THE 19TH CAR TO DERAIL. THE SPEED OF THE TRAIN WAS APPROXIMATELY 4MPH AT THE TIME OF THE DERAILMENT. WHEN THE TWO CARS DROPPED BETWEEN THE RAILS IT BROKE EVERY TIE THEY RODE ON DUE TO THE TIES BEING FIR AND THE DERAILED CARS BEING COVERED HOPPERS LOADED WITH 100 TONS OF GRAIN EACH. WHEN THE WHEELS CUT THE TIES IN TWO, THE TRUCKS SANK INTO THE GROUND ON THE INSIDE OF THE CURVE CAUSING THEM TO TIP OVER TO THE SOUTH. THE 20TH CAR WAS ALSO DERAILED WITH THE EAST END OF LTHE CAR BURIED LIN THE BALLAST UP TO THE TOP OF THE TRUCK BOLSTERS.NoneNoneNoneNone

D1590-d-05-12-90-RFP.Narrative: WHILE PREPARING TWELVE(12) LOCOMOTIVE UNITS TO BE BROUGHT INTO BRYAN PARK TERMINAL ON NO. 11 TRACK TO BE SERVICED, THE HOSTLER VISUALLY CHECKED ALLL TWELVE (12) UNITS AND THOUGHT THEY WERE PROPERLY COUPLED TOGETHER. THE HOSTLER THEN RELEASED THE BRAKES ON THE REAR LOCOMOTIVE UNITS AND STARTED MOVINGTHE CONSIST OF TWELVE (12) UNITS FORWARD. THE FIRST THREE (3) LOCOMOTIVE UNITS UNCOUPLED AND PULLEDAWAY FROM THE NINE (9) REAR LOCOMOTIVES. THE HOSTLER, SEEING THE NINE (9) LOCOMOTIVES HAD UNCOUPLEDAND SEPARATED FROM THE THREE (3) LOCOMOTIVES, STOPPED THE THREE (3) LOCOMOTIVES ON NO. 11 TRACK, GOT DOWN FROM THE LEAD LOCOMOTIVE AND MADE AN ATTEMPT TO RUN BACK AND CATCH THE NINE (9) LOCOMOTIVES THAT WERE ROLLING DOWN NO. 11 TRACK TOWARD THE THREE STOPPED LOCOMOTIVES. THE HOSTLER WAS UNABLE TO BOARD THE NINE LOCOMOTIVE CONSIST, ANTHE LEAD LOCOMOTIVE, RFP 123, IMPACTED WITH THE THIRD LOCOMOTIVE, CSXT5830, IN THE CONSIST OF THREE LOCOMOTIVES, CAUSING BOTH RFP 123 AND CSXT 5830 TO DERAIL.THE SECOND LOCOMOTIVE, CSXT 5888, IN THE CONSIST OF NINE LOCOMOTIVES, ALSO DERAILED.NoneNoneNoneNone

050890A-d-05-08-90-ATK.Narrative: TRAIN 467'S DRAFT HAD RECEIVED PERMISSION FROM THE YARD 5 FOREMAN TO PROCEED DOWN THE WASH TRACK TOTHE WYE TRACK. A YARD MOVEMENT CONSISTING OF ENGINE 904 AND CONTROL CAR 1627 WAS MAKING A SWITCHINGMOVE FROMDIESEL 3 TO WASH WHICH BOTH TRAINS WERE MOVING IN AN EASTERLY DIRECTION. THE ENGINEER ON LOCOMOTIVE 904 WAS CONTROLLING THE MOVING WITH THELOCOMOTIVE ON THE LEAD END. ENGINE 904 IS A GP-9 ANDWAS BEING OPERATED WITH LONG HOOD FORWARD WITH THE ENGINEER ON THE OPPOSITE SIDE FROM 467. THE ENGINEER OF 904 WAS ALSO LOOKING BACK AND OBSERVING THE UTILITY MAN ON THE REAR OF COACH 1627 DROPPING OFF TO THROW A SWITCH. IT WAS AT THIS POINT WHEN THE YARD MOVE (904) APPROACHED THE WYE TRACK AND STRUCK COACH 403 WHICH WAS ALREADY ACCOMPANYING THE WYE TRACK. BOTH TRAINS STOPPED IMMEDIATELY UPON IMPACT WITH TRAIN 467 DERAILING THE TWO LEAD CARS OF THE DRAFT. DUE TO THE NATURE OF THE INCIDENT AND DAMAGE SUSTAINED D & A TESTING WAS CONDUCTED ON ALL CREW MEMBERS INVOLVED RESULTS WERE NEGATIVE.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone

THIS ALLOWED R-1 WHEEL TO DROPO INSIDE WEST RAILSIMULTANEOUSLY. IMMEDIATELY FOLLOWING, L-2 WHEEL CLIMBED HIGH RAIL OFCURVE (EAST RAIL) AND RAN ON TOP OF BALL OF RAIL FORAPPROXIMATELY 13 RAIL LENGTHS. THIS ALLOWED R-2 WHEEL TO DROP INSIDE WEST RAIL EVENTUALLY---ALLACTION DESCRIBED ABOVE WEAKENED TRACK STRUCTURE AND WIDENED GAUGE ALLOWING ALL WHEELS OF FOLLOWING 3 CARS TO DERAIL AT UNDETERMINEDTIMES AND EXACT LOCATIONS. A TOTAL OF APPROXIMATELY 230 FT OF TRACK SRUCTURE WAS DESTROYED. AT TIME OF DERAILMENT, TRAIN AIR BRAKES WERE ACCOMPOLISHINGA RUNNING RELEASE OF APPROXIMATELY 12 LBS TOTAL REDUCTIONAND THROTTLE WAS BEING ADVANCED GRADUALLY TO COMPENSATE FOR THE ASCENTOF A SMALL GRADE THE HEAD PORTION OF THE TRAIN WAS COMMENCING TO CLIMB. SPEED WAS ESTIMATAED AT6 TO 8 MPH AT TIME OF DERAILMENT.NoneNoneNoneNone
